solution_line_template: If each lap is {lap_length} meters long, then {num_laps} laps will have a total distance of {lap_length}*{num_laps} = <<{lap_length}*{num_laps}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} meters

The total time he ran was {first_lap_time} on the first lap + {second_lap_time} on the second one and {third_lap_time} on the third lap, so his total running time was = {first_lap_time}+{second_lap_time}+{third_lap_time} = <<{first_lap_time}+{second_lap_time}+{third_lap_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} seconds

His average speed then is measured by the total distance he ran ({total_distance}) divided by the total time required ({total_time}) or {total_distance}/{total_time} = <<{total_distance}/{total_time}={average_speed}>>{average_speed} m/s
